item.title: Main Tank Boost Pumps Main Tank 2 and 3 Boost Pumps – Aft Boost Pumps Engine Driven Generator Systems Operative Alternate Method

remarks.para: One aft boost pump may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: All main tank 1 and 4 boost pumps and main tank 2 and 3 fwd boost pumps are operative,
Fuel quantity indicating system for the associated tank is operative,
All engine driven generator systems are operative, and
The following minimum fuel quantities are retained in the associated tank for the flight conditions shown (normal fuel loading, balance and usage requirements still apply):

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:
Inoperative boost pump operations may require large amounts of fuel to be retained in the main fuel tanks for takeoff and landing. Payload and/or range restrictions may result.

numlitem.para: For takeoff: Main tanks 2 and 3 contain a minimum of 78,390 lbs of fuel each and main tanks 1 and 4 are fueled to capacity.
For landing: Main tanks 1, 2, 3 and 4 contain a minimum of 8,610 lbs of fuel each.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to affected pump switch: "#___ AFT FUEL PUMP INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
